017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.lang.constant.Constable;
020import java.lang.constant.ConstantDesc;
021import java.lang.constant.DynamicConstantDesc;
022import java.lang.constant.MethodHandleDesc;
023
024import java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType;
025import java.lang.reflect.Type;
026
027import java.util.Arrays;
028import java.util.List;
029import java.util.Objects;
030import java.util.Optional;
031
032import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.BSM_INVOKE;
033import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.DEFAULT_NAME;
034
035import static org.microbean.type.ConstantDescs.CD_DefaultParameterizedType;
036import static org.microbean.type.ConstantDescs.CD_Type;
037
038/**
039 * A {@link ParameterizedType} implementation.
040 *
041 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
042 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
043 *
044 * @see ParameterizedType
045 */
046public final class DefaultParameterizedType implements Constable, ParameterizedType {
047
048
049  /*
050   * Instance fields.
051   */
052
053
054  private final Type ownerType;
055
056  private final Type rawType;
057
058  private final Type[] actualTypeArguments;
059
060  private final int hashCode;
061
062
063  /*
064   * Constructors.
065   */
066
067
068  /**
069   * Creates a new {@link DefaultParameterizedType}.
070   *
071   * @param ownerType the {@link Type} that owns this {@link
072   * DefaultParameterizedType}; may be (and usually is) {@code null}
073   *
074   * @param rawType the raw type; must not be {@code null}; is most
075   * commonly a {@link Class} as in all JDKs through at least 17 and
076   * as mandated currently by the Java Language Specification
077   *
078   * @param actualTypeArgument the actual {@linkplain
079   * #getActualTypeArguments() actual type argument} of this {@link
080   * DefaultParameterizedType}; must not be {@code null}
081   *
082   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code rawType} or {@code
083   * actualTypeArgument} is {@code null}
084   *
085   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code rawType} is an
086   * {@linkplain Class#isInstance(Object) instance of} {@link Class}
087   * and the length of the array returned by its {@link
088   * Class#getTypeParameters()} method is not {@code 1}
089   */
090  public DefaultParameterizedType(final Type ownerType, final Type rawType, final Type actualTypeArgument) {
091    super();
092    this.ownerType = ownerType;
093    this.rawType = Objects.requireNonNull(rawType, "rawType");
094    if (rawType instanceof Class<?> cls && cls.getTypeParameters().length != 1) {
095      throw new IllegalArgumentException("rawType: " + JavaTypes.toString(rawType) +
096                                         "; actualTypeArguments: " + JavaTypes.toString(actualTypeArgument));
097    }
098    this.actualTypeArguments = new Type[] { Objects.requireNonNull(actualTypeArgument, "actualTypeArgument") };
099    this.hashCode = this.computeHashCode();
100  }
101
102  /**
103   * Creates a new {@link DefaultParameterizedType}.
104   *
105   * @param ownerType the {@link Type} that owns this {@link
106   * DefaultParameterizedType}; may be (and usually is) {@code null}
107   *
108   * @param rawType the raw type; must not be {@code null}; is most
109   * commonly a {@link Class} as in all JDKs through at least 17 and
110   * as mandated currently by the Java Language Specification
111   *
112   * @param actualTypeArgument0 the first actual {@linkplain
113   * #getActualTypeArguments() actual type argument} of this {@link
114   * DefaultParameterizedType}; must not be {@code null}
115   *
116   * @param actualTypeArgument1 the second actual {@linkplain
117   * #getActualTypeArguments() actual type argument} of this {@link
118   * DefaultParameterizedType}; must not be {@code null}
119   *
120   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code rawType} or any type
121   * argument is {@code null}
122   *
123   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code rawType} is an
124   * {@linkplain Class#isInstance(Object) instance of} {@link Class}
125   * and the length of the array returned by its {@link
126   * Class#getTypeParameters()} method is not {@code 2}
127   */
128  public DefaultParameterizedType(final Type ownerType,
129                                  final Type rawType,
130                                  final Type actualTypeArgument0,
131                                  final Type actualTypeArgument1) {
132    super();
133    this.ownerType = ownerType;
134    this.rawType = Objects.requireNonNull(rawType, "rawType");
135    if (rawType instanceof Class<?> cls && cls.getTypeParameters().length != 2) {
136      throw new IllegalArgumentException("rawType: " + JavaTypes.toString(rawType) +
137                                         "; actualTypeArguments: " + List.of(actualTypeArgument0, actualTypeArgument1));
138    }
139    this.actualTypeArguments = new Type[] {
140      Objects.requireNonNull(actualTypeArgument0, "actualTypeArgument0"),
141      Objects.requireNonNull(actualTypeArgument1, "actualTypeArgument1")
142    };
143    this.hashCode = this.computeHashCode();
144  }
145
146  /**
147   * Creates a new {@link DefaultParameterizedType}.
148   *
149   * @param ownerType the {@link Type} that owns this {@link
150   * DefaultParameterizedType}; may be (and usually is) {@code null}
151   *
152   * @param rawType the raw type; must not be {@code null}; is most
153   * commonly a {@link Class} as in all JDKs through at least 17 and
154   * as mandated currently by the Java Language Specification
155   *
156   * @param actualTypeArguments the actual {@linkplain
157   * #getActualTypeArguments() actual type arguments} of this {@link
158   * DefaultParameterizedType}; may be {@code null} in which case a
159   * zero-length array will be used instead; will be cloned if
160   * non-{@code null} and if its length is greater than {@code 0}
161   *
162   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code rawType} is {@code
163   * null}
164   *
165   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code rawType} is an
166   * {@linkplain Class#isInstance(Object) instance of} {@link Class}
167   * and the length of the array returned by its {@link
168   * Class#getTypeParameters()} method is not the same as the length
169   * of the {@link actualTypeArguments} array (or {@code 0} if the
170   * {@code actualTypeArguments} array is {@code null})
171   */
172
173  /**
174   * Creates a new {@link DefaultParameterizedType}.
175   *
176   * @param ownerType the {@link Type} that owns this {@link
177   * DefaultParameterizedType}; may be (and usually is) {@code null}
178   *
179   * @param rawType the raw type; must not be {@code null}; is most
180   * commonly a {@link Class} as in all JDKs through at least 17 and
181   * as mandated currently by the Java Language Specification
182   *
183   * @param actualTypeArgument0 the first actual {@linkplain
184   * #getActualTypeArguments() actual type argument} of this {@link
185   * DefaultParameterizedType}; must not be {@code null}
186   *
187   * @param actualTypeArgument1 the second actual {@linkplain
188   * #getActualTypeArguments() actual type argument} of this {@link
189   * DefaultParameterizedType}; must not be {@code null}
190   *
191   * @param actualTypeArgument2 the third actual {@linkplain
192   * #getActualTypeArguments() actual type argument} of this {@link
193   * DefaultParameterizedType}; must not be {@code null}
194   *
195   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code rawType} or any type
196   * argument is {@code null}
197   *
198   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code rawType} is an
199   * {@linkplain Class#isInstance(Object) instance of} {@link Class}
200   * and the length of the array returned by its {@link
201   * Class#getTypeParameters()} method is not {@code 3}
202   */
203  public DefaultParameterizedType(final Type ownerType,
204                                  final Type rawType,
205                                  final Type actualTypeArgument0,
206                                  final Type actualTypeArgument1,
207                                  final Type actualTypeArgument2) {
208    
209    super();
210    this.ownerType = ownerType;
211    this.rawType = Objects.requireNonNull(rawType, "rawType");
212    if (rawType instanceof Class<?> cls && cls.getTypeParameters().length != 3) {
213      throw new IllegalArgumentException("rawType: " + JavaTypes.toString(rawType) +
214                                         "; actualTypeArguments: " +
215                                         List.of(actualTypeArgument0, actualTypeArgument1, actualTypeArgument2));
216    }
217    this.actualTypeArguments = new Type[] {
218      Objects.requireNonNull(actualTypeArgument0, "actualTypeArgument0"),
219      Objects.requireNonNull(actualTypeArgument1, "actualTypeArgument1"),
220      Objects.requireNonNull(actualTypeArgument2, "actualTypeArgument2")
221    };
222    this.hashCode = this.computeHashCode();
223  }
224  
225  /**
226   * Creates a new {@link DefaultParameterizedType}.
227   *
228   * @param ownerType the {@link Type} that owns this {@link
229   * DefaultParameterizedType}; may be (and usually is) {@code null}
230   *
231   * @param rawType the raw type; must not be {@code null}; is most
232   * commonly a {@link Class} as in all JDKs through at least 17 and
233   * as mandated currently by the Java Language Specification
234   *
235   * @param actualTypeArguments the actual {@linkplain
236   * #getActualTypeArguments() actual type arguments} of this {@link
237   * DefaultParameterizedType}; may be {@code null} in which case a
238   * zero-length array will be used instead; will be cloned if
239   * non-{@code null} and if its length is greater than {@code 0}
240   *
241   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code rawType} is {@code
242   * null}
243   *
244   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code rawType} is an
245   * {@linkplain Class#isInstance(Object) instance of} {@link Class}
246   * and the length of the array returned by its {@link
247   * Class#getTypeParameters()} method is not the same as the length
248   * of the {@link actualTypeArguments} array (or {@code 0} if the
249   * {@code actualTypeArguments} array is {@code null})
250   */
251  public DefaultParameterizedType(final Type ownerType, final Type rawType, final Type... actualTypeArguments) {
252    super();
253    this.ownerType = ownerType;
254    this.rawType = Objects.requireNonNull(rawType, "rawType");
255    if (actualTypeArguments == null || actualTypeArguments.length <= 0) {
256      this.actualTypeArguments = JavaTypes.emptyTypeArray();
257    } else {
258      this.actualTypeArguments = actualTypeArguments.clone();
259    }
260    if (rawType instanceof Class<?> cls) {
261      final Type[] typeParameters = cls.getTypeParameters();
262      if (typeParameters.length != this.actualTypeArguments.length) {
263        throw new IllegalArgumentException("rawType: " + JavaTypes.toString(rawType) +
264                                           "; actualTypeArguments: " + Arrays.asList(actualTypeArguments));
265      }
266    }
267    this.hashCode = this.computeHashCode();
268  }
269
270  /**
271   * Creates a new {@link DefaultParameterizedType}.
272   *
273   * @param other the {@link ParameterizedType} to copy information
274   * from; must not be {@code null}
275   *
276   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code other} is {@code null}
277   *
278   * @see #DefaultParameterizedType(Type, Type, Type...)
279   */
280  public DefaultParameterizedType(final ParameterizedType other) {
281    this(other.getOwnerType(), other.getRawType(), other.getActualTypeArguments());
282  }
283
284
285  /*
286   * Instance methods.
287   */
288
289
290  @Override // ParameterizedType
291  public final Type getOwnerType() {
292    return this.ownerType;
293  }
294
295  @Override // ParameterizedType
296  public final Type getRawType() {
297    return this.rawType;
298  }
299
300  @Override // ParameterizedType
301  public final Type[] getActualTypeArguments() {
302    return this.actualTypeArguments.clone();
303  }
304
305  @Override // Constable
306  public final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable() {
307    final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> ownerType = JavaTypes.describeConstable(this.getOwnerType());
308    if (ownerType.isPresent()) {
309      final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> rawType = JavaTypes.describeConstable(this.getRawType());
310      if (rawType.isPresent()) {
311        final Type[] actualTypeArguments = this.getActualTypeArguments();
312        final int bsmInvokeArgumentsLength = actualTypeArguments.length + 3;
313        final ConstantDesc[] bsmInvokeArguments = new ConstantDesc[bsmInvokeArgumentsLength];
314        bsmInvokeArguments[0] =
315          MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_DefaultParameterizedType,
316                                         CD_Type,
317                                         CD_Type,
318                                         CD_Type.arrayType());
319        bsmInvokeArguments[1] = ownerType.orElseThrow();
320        bsmInvokeArguments[2] = rawType.orElseThrow();
321        for (int i = 3; i < bsmInvokeArgumentsLength; i++) {
322          final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> arg = JavaTypes.describeConstable(actualTypeArguments[i - 3]);
323          if (arg.isEmpty()) {
324            return Optional.empty();
325          }
326          bsmInvokeArguments[i] = arg.orElseThrow();
327        }
328        return Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
329                                                       DEFAULT_NAME,
330                                                       CD_DefaultParameterizedType,
331                                                       bsmInvokeArguments));
332      }
333    }
334    return Optional.empty();
335  }
336  
337  @Override // Object
338  public final int hashCode() {
339    return this.hashCode;
340  }
341
342  private final int computeHashCode() {
343    return JavaTypes.hashCode(this);
344  }
345
346  @Override // Object
347  public final boolean equals(final Object other) {
348    if (other == this) {
349      return true;
350    } else if (other instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
351      return JavaTypes.equals(this, p);
352    } else {
353      return false;
354    }
355  }
356
357  @Override // Object
358  public final String toString() {
359    return JavaTypes.toString(this);
360  }
361
362
363  /*
364   * Static methods.
365   */
366
367
368  /**
369   * If the supplied {@link ParameterizedType} is a {@link
370   * DefaultParameterizedType}, returns it; otherwise creates a new
371   * {@link DefaultParameterizedType} with the supplied {@link
372   * ParameterizedType}'s {@linkplain ParameterizedType#getOwnerType()
373   * owner type}, {@linkplain ParameterizedType#getRawType() raw type}
374   * and {@linkplain ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() type
375   * arguments} and returns it.
376   *
377   * @param parameterizedType the {@link ParameterizedType} to
378   * effectively copy (or return); must not be {@code null}
379   *
380   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link DefaultParameterizedType}
381   *
382   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code parameterizedType} is
383   * {@code null}
384   *
385   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
386   *
387   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
388   * that it may return a new {@link DefaultParameterizedType} with
389   * each invocation).
390   *
391   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
392   * threads.
393   */
394  public static final DefaultParameterizedType of(final ParameterizedType parameterizedType) {
395    if (parameterizedType instanceof DefaultParameterizedType p) {
396      return p;
397    } else {
398      return new DefaultParameterizedType(parameterizedType);
399    }
400  }
401
402
403}
